citation.article-title: Ectothiorhodospira vacuolata sp. nov., a new phototrophic bacterium from soda lakes.

p.s: Description of Ectothiorhodospira vacuolata sp. nov.
Ectothiorhodospira vacuolata (va. cu. o. la'ta L. adj. vacuolatus containing vacuoles)
Cells are rod shaped. 1.5 μm wide and 2-4 μm long, divide by binary fission and are motile by polar flagella.
Under certain growth conditions cells become immotile and float to the top due to the presence of gas vacuoles.
Intracellular photosynthetic membranes are present as lamellar stacks.
Bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids of the normal spirilloxanthin series.
DNA base ratio. 61.4-63.6 mol% guanine plus cytosine, 63.6 mol% in the type strain.
Photosynthetic electron donors used are sulfide. thiosulfate, acetate, malate, succinate, fumarate, pyruvate and propionate.
No vitamins required, optimal salt range 1 - 6 % NaCl, light saturation at more than 3000 lux, pH optima at 7.5- 8.5 and 9.0-9.5 with inorganic reduced sulfur source and organic carbon source.
Alkaline salt lakes, soda lakes and similar habitats, containing hydrogen sulfide and exposed to the light.
Strain BN 9512, isolated as "β1", also deposited with the German Collection of Microorganisms (DSM), Göttingen, under number DSM 2111.
